points.title: Scripture & Gospel Centrality
points.description: Scripture as Authority and Centrality of the Gospel

subQuestions.text: Is Scripture viewed as the inerrant Word of God and used as the absolute standard for faith and practice?
Is there a general understanding that the Gospel is the grand and central theme of the Bible?
Are there clear pathways and practices that facilitate ongoing Gospel renewal?
Is there consistent weekly corporate worship that invites members to glorify God and make the Gospel clear and near?
Are sound, expository, Gospel-centered and contextual sermons preached weekly?
Are the sacraments/ordinances of baptism and the Lord's Supper practised regularly and meaningfully?
Do elders and leaders enjoy and model a vibrant, Gospel-centered prayer life?
Is prayer a regular and joyful part of everyday church life?
Are members being invited and equipped for a true and rich prayer life?
Is the Gospel understood as the primary motivation for sanctification?
Is 'all of life' discipleship taught and practiced as part of church life?
Are there clear pathways for growth as disciples both for new believers and mature?

points.title: NT Patterns of Church Life
points.description: New Testament Patterns of Church Life

subQuestions.text: Is every member encouraged and equipped for ministry?
Are small groups thriving, with leaders discipling members?
Is church discipline understood and practiced Biblically?

points.title: Leadership Development
points.description: Leadership Development and Biblically Qualified Elders (Self-Governing)

subQuestions.text: Does the church have a clear Leadership Development Pathway?
Is there a clear pathway to identify and nurture Small Group Leaders?
Is there a pathway to identify, assess, train, and commission Deacons and Elders?
Is there regular and healthy preaching on generosity?
Is there a culture of generosity and consistent giving?
Are all church operations funded through member giving (self-supporting)?

points.title: City Culture Engagement
points.description: City Culture and People are Being Engaged with the Gospel; People Being Saved

subQuestions.text: Is the church ministering to Christians and non-Christians simultaneously in worship?
Are vibrant Faith & Work practices integrated into discipleship?
Is there intentional and compassionate practice of Mercy and Justice?

points.title: Evangelism Contextualization
points.description: Believers Able to Share the Gospel in Multiple Contextual Ways

subQuestions.text: Do believers understand the Gospel clearly and are they being equipped to share it?
Are members building friendships with non-Christians and engaging them in Gospel conversations?
Do members understand and address cultural "defeater beliefs" winsomely?
Do leaders and members understand and appreciate the Biblical charge to plant churches?
Does the church have meaningful partnerships with other churches and para-church organizations?
Does the leadership demonstrate a movement mindset and intentionally live it out?
